intro: Galium angustissimum, commonly known as narrowleaf bedstraw, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is a low-growing perennial herb characterized by its slender stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, white to pinkish flowers that bloom in clusters, typically from late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Galium angustissimum is often found in temperate regions of Europe and Asia.
